label: 朝臣
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: a kabane, one of the eight such titles employed by Great King Temmu in his reconfiguration of the Kiyomihara court in 684. Its bearers, some 52 lineages (uji) in 684, were second in prestige to those dubbed mahito 真人. Many asomi lineages were collaterals of old royal lines.　[天武、浄御原宮、氏]
